info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:24PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN COLEMAN...SOUTHEASTERN RUNNELS AND NORTH CENTRAL CONCHO COUNTIES... At 423 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Talpa, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Valera and Glen Cove around 440 PM CDT. Silver Valley around 455 PM CDT. Coleman around 500 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Hords Creek Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
